page.title: 06HOW WE COMMUTE.
page.content: Rainham is well within the community hinterland of London.This is clearly shown by the numbers of people who use the station each day.Many people travel by car and by coach too.Also,the growth in the number of houses,particularly housing estates such as Wigmore,are directly related to the increasing numbers of people who commute to London each day.The reasons for commuting are several.Firstly,house prices are much lower here than in outer London which means that they can live in larger, better quality houses than would other wise be the case.Secondly,Rainham is on the edge of the built up area of the Medway towns conurbation,and therefore close to open farmland and the remnants of extensive beech woodland.It is a good commuting area,as there are good roads and a good railway services mainly into London.
